title: Warren Gatland calls in son Bryn to train with Wales as Prince Charles visits team in Tokyo
text:
Warren Gatland recruited his own son to help Wales prepare for Sunday's crunch World Cup semi-final with South Africa.

At their training session on Wednesday afternoon, Gatland called on son Bryn to boost numbers. It came after Prince Charles watched Wales warm up for the Springboks encounter earlier in the day.

Bryn Gatland is a talented fly-half who played against the British & Irish Lions – then coached by his father – in the opening match of the tour of New Zealand in 2017. The 24-year-old Highlanders playmaker is on his way back from a horrific foot injury which he suffered at the end of April when playing in New Zealand's Super Rugby competition.
